summary: The U.S. commercial space transportation industry continues to evolve. More launches are putting more satellites and other payloads into space, and companies are edging closer to offering space tourism. FAA's Office of Commercial Space Transportation (AST) is responsible for regulating and promoting this industry. This testimony gives an update on AST's progress in adapting to industry change. For example, AST has streamlined rules for applicants...
title: Commercial Space Transportation: FAA Continues to Update Regulations and Faces Challenges to Overseeing an Evolving Industry
